The film is about a young woman who wants to become a doctor, but can't because she doesn't have enough money to pay for her education. She meets an ex-boyfriend who agrees to give her $2,000 to spend with him. In exchange, he asks her to go back to her mother's house, and when she does, she finds out that her parents are dead. One day, the family comes to visit, so she goes on a date with them. The next morning, they find out where her boyfriend is, along with her sister and her husband. Soon, all of a sudden, things start to get complicated. When she meets up with Mr. Zucco, there is a fight between her and him, as well as his wife, who has been cheating on him in the past.

... the film is very dark and bleak. It's hard to believe that this was made in 1957. The only character I can think of who could relate to this film was a young girl named Lucy who had been raised by her father. She didn't seem to have any sympathy for anyone at all. When she came out of the closet, it became clear that she wasn't really going to be able to cope with the situation. Her father died when she was seven years old and Lucy was left to fend for herself.<citation needed] <strong><brief pause>Lucy's father's death shocked Lucy. In the wake of her mother's marriage, Lucy began to realize that there was nothing she could do to help her younger sister. Instead, she decided to leave her family and live with her parents. However, as Lucy learned more and more about her new surroundings, her feelings for her sister grew even more intense.
